content.description:
The White Line is a fun sport route to the right of the

Step Ladder

. The crux is towards the top of the route.
content.protection: 5 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor with rappel rings.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map. The base of the route is marked by a large white streak on the rock.

content.description: The bottom half of the route has good footholds and hand holds. The first crux is about halfway up the route at a small overhang. There is a good rest spot above the overhang, and the top half of the route has a series of small ledges. The second crux is getting established in the finger crack at the top.
content.protection: 12 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor with rappel rings.
content.location: See Nirvana Wall route map.

content.description:
The route can be made easier by going left at the top instead of following the line to the right.

The bolts at the top have rappel rings.
content.protection: Bolts at the top.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map.

content.description:
This climb has two big steps. The bottom has a couple of fun crack moves, and the top is slab. It is best used as an access route to get to the base of

Truly Hell

.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Start at the back of the gully at the left end of Nirvana Wall.

content.description:
Follow the first seam to the left of

Piton Pilsner

. There are rappel rings on the bolts at the top.
content.protection: Bolts at the top.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map.

content.description: Start the route with a mantel up on to the slab at the start of the crack. Then proceed to lieback and lock your way up the crack until it is no more. Finish by grabbing a small crimp directly underneath the bolts.
content.protection: 1 (0.5), 2 (0.4), 1 (0.3), a rack of small nuts, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
The climb is located about a mile up the trail on the north side, facing west, just after the scenic overlook before the entrance to the canyon.

The GPS coordinates are: 38.98704, -104.90810.

content.description: Shred Bread is a fun first lead! Climb the bolt line for the 5.6 rating or make variations for harder/easier ascents. Climb a boulder problem start to easy slab climbing with an airy finish. Trust your feet!
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: The climb starts on the right side of the wall, just under a large tree, and tops out under the sideways tree. It is the only sport route.

content.description: Ratatouille 22 climbs a great offwidth/narrow chimney using lots of chicken wings and jamming your entire body. The crack is a large split in a boulder.
content.protection: Bolts at the top, and you need a long accessory cord or static rope to make a good anchor. It could be lead if you have some large cams (#5+).
content.location:
Follow Stanley Canyon Trail. It is located on the far left side of Nirvana Wall under the highline anchors and next to the bolts for

Step Ladder

and

Truly Hell

.

content.description:
Start on the low arete, and follow the seam to the top. The first clips are the hardest.

There are rappel rings on the bolts at the top.
content.protection: Bolts at the top.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map.

content.description:
There is a set of bolts midway up this route and at the top. There is a good shelf below the first set of bolts to practice top belaying for multi-pitch sport routes.

The top set of bolts has rappel rings.
content.protection: Bolts at the top and at halfway.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map.

content.description:
Climb the band of rock with a solid piton about 15 feet up. Climb past the chockstone and tree to a 2 bolt anchor at the top of

Shred Bread

.
content.protection: 2 angle pitons supplemented with trad pro to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: It is the rightmost climb on the wall and climbs the wide seam.

content.description:
This ascends the right crack on a distinct pillar where the wall increases in height. It has good ledges to practice trad placement.

There are bolts with rappel rings at the top.
content.protection: Bolts at the top.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map.

content.description:
This ascends the left crack on a distinct pillar where the wall increases in height. It has good ledges to practice trad placement.

There are bolts with rappel rings at the top.
content.protection: Bolts at the top.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map.

content.description:
This route follows the seam to the right of the dirty crack.

Sling a boulder or use the dead tree to set a TR anchor.
content.protection: None.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map.

content.description:
Follow the face in between the two pillar crack routes.

The bolts at the top have rappel rings.
content.protection: Bolts at the top.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map.

content.description:
There is a set of bolts midway up this route and at the top. There is a good shelf below the first set of bolts to practice top belaying for multi-pitch sport routes.

The top set of bolts has rappel rings.
content.protection: Bolts at the top and at halfway.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map.

content.description: Climb the easiest corner/seam directly under the anchor. Continue past the left of the bulge to stay true to the grade.
content.protection: This is a toprope only at the moment. It has a 2 bolt anchor with Metolius rap hangers.
content.location:
Access the anchors by topping out via

Shred Bread

and walking climber's left.

content.description:
Follow the face up to the left side of a large bulge. The route can be made easier by going completely around the bulge on the left side.

The bolts at the top have rappel rings.
content.protection: Bolts at the top.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map.

content.description: The Nirvana Wall Highline is approximately 90 feet long and 50 feet off the ground. About 75 feet are walkable if you want to avoid no-fall terrain. Over 100 feet of webbing is recommended for rigging.
content.protection: There are quicklinks on all the bolts.
content.location:
The Northwest set of bolts is located on a pillar near the base of

Truly Hell

at GPS coordinates 38.98795, -104.90856. The Southeast set is to the left of the Gnar Butter anchor at GPS coordinates 38.98782, -104.90831. Both anchor points are marked on the Nirvana Wall route map.

The Northwest anchor can be accessed most easily by climbing the

Step Ladder

(sport, 5.7) and walking up and around to the top of the pillar. For the Southeast anchor, climb

Psych Cream

(sport, 5.8), and then anchor off a tree to rappel down to the bolts. Tensioning from the Northwest side is easiest, because there is more room to move around on the pillar.

content.description:
Follow the face up to the right side of a large bulge. The route can be made easier by going completely around the bulge on the right side.

The bolts at the top have rappel rings.
content.protection: Bolts at the top.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map.

content.description: Gnar Butter ascends a spicy, steep hand/finger crack - a great crack climb for Nirvana Wall. The protection goes in well, but make sure the rock is solid. There are spots with choss. The crux is the first 2/3 of the route. Pull the overhang, and cruise up 5.6/5.7 terrain to the two bolt anchor.
content.protection: A standard rack and a 2 bolt anchor. Use BD cams from #0.2-2 and a variety of nuts.

content.description:
Climb the slab between

Pump Pasta

and

Psych Cream

. There are rappel rings on the bolts at the top.
content.protection: 2 bolts at the top.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map.

content.description: As the name implies, this crack is very dirty. It is a good first trad route with easy moves and lots of good ledges to fiddle with placement.
content.protection: Gear for a fist width crack.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map.

content.description:
The Black Line is a fun, short sport route to the right of

The White Line

.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor with rappel rings.
content.location: See the Nirvana Wall route map. The route is marked by a black vein in the rock.
